thread.title: The Kardashians won't be posting content online while Lamar Odom fights for his life
thread.title_full: The Kardashians won't be posting content online while Lamar Odom fights for his life

title: The Kardashians won't be posting content online while Lamar Odom fights for his life
text:
The Kardashians won't be posting content online while Lamar Odom fights for his life The Kardashians won't be posting content online while Lamar Odom fights for his life 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Khloe Kardashian won’t be posting content online while her estranged husband Lamar Odom battles for his life. 
The 35-year-old former Los Angeles Laker’s star was found unconscious on Tuesday October 13 at the Love Ranch brothel in Nevada, Las Vegas. 
Khloe has remained by his side at the Sunrise Hospital & Medical Center in Vegas. Khloe Kardashian and Lamar Odom (AP Photo/Evan Agostini) 
The Kardashians won’t be updating new content to their smart phone applications. The decision was publicised on the home pages of their apps’ sites: 
“As a family, we have decided to hold off on publishing content across our apps while we continue to support and pray for Lamar. Thank you for your kindness and understanding during this difficult time,” the statement read. 
Just about every aspect of their lives is documented, whether it’s via television show Keeping Up With The Kardashians, aired by the E! network, or on various social media channels. 
The family as a whole have millions of followers on sites such as Twitter and Instagram. 
Sources have said Lamar is on life support, with celebrity site TMZ claiming he has a 50/50 chance of survival. 
Lamar and Khloe’s relationship featured in the family reality show and its spin-off Khloe And Lamar. Kendall Jenner, Khloe and Kylie Jenner (Jordan Strauss/Invision/AP) 
The couple married in 2009 after a whirlwind romance. They signed divorce papers earlier this year, but the divorce has not yet been finalised and they are still legally married. 
Meanwhile, Lamar’s aunt and godmother have thanked the public for their support. 
A statement issued on their behalf said: “No words can express the overwhelming gratitude we feel for the outpouring of support from around the world.” Share article 
Authorities said the NBA star had used cocaine and so-called herbal Viagra. There has been no official update about his condition. Promoted Stories
